title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement stephus.daus@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to saros
text: outlines propose change saros. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to saros
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to saros
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to saros
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("NIFU-/saros", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to saros
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to saros
text: Please note saros project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Connection to the Astronomical concept of Saros
title: saros_name
text: term “saros” also refers cyclical phenomenon astronomy known Saros cycle, represents period approximately 18 years, 11 days, 8 hours. one Saros cycle, Sun, Earth, Moon return approximately relative positions, leading similar eclipse. Cyclical occurrences: case R package, cyclical events relates surveys repeated annually biannually, astronomy, cyclical events refers recurring pattern eclipses. Consistency: saros R package aims maintain consistency reporting analysis across survey iterations, just astronomical Saros cycle represents predictable pattern occurrence solar lunar eclipses. Time-saving: saros R package designed automate streamline process summarizing reporting survey data, saving researchers time effort. Similarly, Saros cycle useful tool astronomers predict plan future eclipses, making easier study events without make complex calculations time.

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: {saros} (Semi-Automatic Reporting Ordinary Surveys) R package designed handle repeating surveys within project occur annually biannually. aims automate process summarizing reporting survey data, helping researchers save time maintain consistency across survey iterations. Specifically, {saros} produces highly customizable figures, tables, analyses complex interactive reports batch possible dependent-independent relations possible interest.

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: Created figures minimal, meaning given full power adjust post-hoc using usual ggplot2::theme() tools, including ggplot2::theme_set(). Several sets chunk templates built , depending type report want. templates provided data frames, can easily adjust create . multitude settings optional glue-templating prefixes, infixes suffixes allows translations adaptations. specified function, use setting. specified, check global options, can specified chapter (qmd-file), entire report, entire project, organization’s settings. none specified, function factory defaults used. Also link creation automatically created Convenience functions set, get reset options Instead using probabilistic AI-tools, ensure reports always come expected. Opinionated, yet highly flexible, interactive {ggiraph}-based figures (building ggplot2) gt-compatible tables. Although built-plotting functions use (somewhat slower performing) ggplot2, easier majority modify plot objects, expand compliant plotting functions. One can also easily insert base/lattice-plotting functions report-drafting templates.

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: Optionally set project directory completely new project. Clean raw data: - Variables stored data type displayed (factor, ordered factor, integer, character, etc). Ordered factors certain outputs kept given order, whereas set unordered factors may e.g. sorted_by = ".upper" (e.g values upper-categories). - Variables variable labels, sets variables variable label prefix. Prefix suffix can split e.g ” - “. Use e.g. {labelled} operations. advanced cleaning, see saros.utils

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pak("saros") # pak::pak("NIFU-NO/saros") # Alternatively, latest developer-version at Github

what: Draft a simple report using defaults, in a temporary folder
title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
code: library(saros) refine_chapter_overview(data = ex_survey,                         chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview) |>   draft_report(data = ex_survey)

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: Dropping
code: library(saros) refine_chapter_overview(data = ex_survey,                         chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview,                         chunk_templates = get_chunk_template_defaults(2),                         always_show_bi_for_indep = "x1_sex",                         hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above = .05) |>   draft_report(data = ex_survey,                prefix_heading_for_group = c(".variable_name_indep" = "---\n"),                serialized_format = "qs" # qs-format, if installed, is faster than rds                )

what: Draft a customized report, one for each participating university
title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: auxiliary variable f_uni included chapter datasets YAML-header QMD-file can refer , chunks later refer global parameter:
code: --- params:     mesos_var: "f_uni"     mesos_group: "Uni of A" # This can be replaced in a command: `quarto render ch1.qmd -P mesos_group:'Uni of A'` --- library(saros) refine_chapter_overview(data = ex_survey,                         chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview,                         chunk_templates = get_chunk_template_defaults(2),                         always_show_bi_for_indep = "x1_sex",                         hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above = .05) |>   draft_report(data = ex_survey,                prefix_heading_for_group = c(".variable_name_indep" = "---\n"),                auxiliary_variables = "f_uni",                serialized_format = "qs"                )

what: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
text: dataset containing fake respondents' answers survey questions. first two, x_sex x_human, intended independent variables, whereas remaining dependent. underscore _ variable names separates item groups (prefix) items (suffix) (.e. a_1-a_9 => + 1-9), whereas ' - ' separates labels. latter corresponds default SurveyXact.

title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey

title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
text: data frame 100 rows 29 variables: x1_sex Gender x2_human respondent human? x3_nationality respondent born? a_1 consent following? - Agreement #1 a_2 consent following? - Agreement #2 a_3 consent following? - Agreement #3 a_4 consent following? - Agreement #4 a_5 consent following? - Agreement #5 a_6 consent following? - Agreement #6 a_7 consent following? - Agreement #7 a_8 consent following? - Agreement #8 a_9 consent following? - Agreement #9 b_1 much like living - Beijing b_2 much like living - Brussels b_3 much like living - Budapest c_1 many years experience - Company c_2 many years experience - Company B d_1 Rate degree confidence following - Driving d_2 Rate degree confidence following - Drinking d_3 Rate degree confidence following - Driving d_4 Rate degree confidence following - Dancing e_1 often following? - Eat e_2 often following? - Eavesdrop e_3 often following? - Exercise e_4 often following? - Encourage someone recently met struggles simple tasks achieve p_1 extent agree disagree following policies - Red Party p_2 extent agree disagree following policies - Green Party p_3 extent agree disagree following policies - Yellow Party p_4 extent agree disagree following policies - Blue Party f_uni following universities prefer study ? open_comments comments survey? resp_status Response status

title: Estimate figure height for a horizontal bar chart — fig_height_h_barchart
text: n_y Integer. Number dependent variables. n_cats_y Integer. Number categories across dependent variables. max_chars_y Integer. Maximum number characters across dependent variables. n_x Integer. Number independent variables. n_cats_x Integer. Number categories across independent variables. max_chars_x Integer. Maximum number characters across independent variables. freq Logical. TRUE, frequency plot categories next . FALSE (default), proportion plot stacked categories. x_axis_label_width Numeric. Width allocated x-axis labels. strip_angle Integer. Angle strip text. main_font_size Numeric. Font size main text. legend_location Character. Location legend ("panel" "plot"). n_legend_lines Integer. Number lines legend. legend_key_chars_equivalence Integer. Approximate number characters legend key equals. max_chars_per_figure_width Integer. Maximum number characters per figure width. multiplier_per_horizontal_line Numeric. Multiplier per horizontal line. multiplier_per_vertical_letter Numeric. Multiplier per vertical letter. multiplier_per_facet Numeric. Multiplier per facet. multiplier_per_legend_line Numeric. Multiplier per legend line. fixed_constant Numeric. Fixed constant added height. figure_width_in_cm Numeric. Width figure centimeters. margin_in_cm Numeric. Margin centimeters. max Numeric. Maximum height. min Numeric. Minimum height.

what: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
text: makeme()-function take argument type one several strings indicate content type output type. function collects registered alternatives. Extensions possible, see . Built-types: Whereas names types can arbitrary, pattern pursued built-types. Prefix indicates dependent data type intended "cat" Categorical (ordinal nominal) data. "chr" Open ended responses character data. "int" Integer numeric data. Suffix indicates output "html" Interactive html, usually want Quarto, Quarto can usually convert formats needed "docx" However, Quarto's Pandoc's docx-support currently still limited, instance vector graphics converted raster graphics docx output. Hence, saros offers types outputs MS Chart vector graphics. Note experimental actively developed. "pdf" basically just shortcut "html" interactive=FALSE

title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
code: get_makeme_types()

title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
text: Character vector

what: Further details about some of the built-in types:
title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
text: "cat_plot_" Likert style plot groups categorical variables sharing categories. "cat_table_" Likert style table. "chr_table_" single-column table listing unique open ended responses. "sigtest_table_" See sigtest_table_\*: Make Table Combinations Univariate/Bivariate Significance Tests Based Variable Types Although hundreds significance tests associations two variables, depending upon distributions, variables types assumptions, fall smaller set popular tests. function runs combinations dependent independent variables data, suitable test (possible) combination. Also supports univariate tests, assumptions mean zero continuous variables equal proportions binary/categorical. function allow adjustments - use original underlying functions (chisq.test, t.test, etc.)

title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
text: makeme() calls generic make_content(), uses S3-method system dispatch relevant method (.e., paste0("make_content.", type)). makeme forwards arguments make_content, following exceptions: dep indep converted dplyr::dplyr_tidy_select()-syntax simple character vectors, simplifying building functions. data_summary attached, contains many useful pieces info many (categorical) displays.

title: Get all registered options for the type-argument in the makeme-function — get_makeme_types
code: get_makeme_types() #> [1] "cat_freq_plot_docx" "cat_plot_html"      "cat_prop_plot_docx" #> [4] "cat_table_html"     "chr_table_html"     "sigtest_table_html"

title: Method for Creating Saros Contents — make_content
text: returned object class depends type. type="*_table_html" always returns tibble. type="*_plot_html" always returns ggplot. type="*_docx" always returns rdocx object path=NULL, side-effect writing docx file disk path set.

what: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link
title: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link
text: file automatically named hash object, removing need come unique file names inside Quarto report. added benefit reducing storage needs objects needing linking identical, stored folder. also allows user download multiple files without worrying accidentally overwriting .

title: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link
code: make_link(   data,   folder = NULL,   file_prefix = NULL,   file_suffix = ".csv",   save_fn = utils::write.csv,   link_prefix = "[download figure data](",   link_suffix = ")",   ... )

title: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link
text: data Data object <data.frame|tbl|obj> Data frame using tabular data save_fn, possibly R object, serializing save_fn provided (e.g. saveRDS()). folder store file scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Defaults folder. file_prefix, file_suffix File prefix/suffix scalar<character> // default: "" ".csv" (optional) file_suffix include dot extension. save_fn Saving function function // default: utils::write.csv Can saving/writing function. However, first argument must object saved, second must path. Hence, ggplot2::ggsave() must wrapped another function filename object swapped. See ggsaver() example wrapper function. link_prefix, link_suffix Link prefix/suffix scalar<character> // default: "[download data](" ")" stuff returned. ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements.

title: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link
text: String.

title: Save data to a file and return a Markdown link — make_link

what: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
text: function allows embedding interactive static plots based various types data using tidyselect syntax variable selection.

title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
code: makeme(   data,   dep = tidyselect::everything(),   indep = NULL,   type = c("cat_plot_html", "int_plot_html", "cat_table_html", "int_table_html",     "sigtest_table_html", "cat_prop_plot_docx", "cat_freq_plot_docx", "int_plot_docx"),   ...,   require_common_categories = TRUE,   crowd = c("all"),   mesos_var = NULL,   mesos_group = NULL,   simplify_output = TRUE,   hide_for_crowd_if_all_na = TRUE,   hide_for_crowd_if_valid_n_below = 0,   hide_for_crowd_if_category_k_below = 2,   hide_for_crowd_if_category_n_below = 0,   hide_for_crowd_if_cell_n_below = 0,   hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd = NULL,   hide_indep_cat_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd = FALSE,   add_n_to_label = FALSE,   add_n_to_category = FALSE,   totals = FALSE,   categories_treated_as_na = NULL,   label_separator = " - ",   showNA = c("ifany", "always", "never"),   data_label = c("percentage_bare", "percentage", "proportion", "count"),   html_interactive = TRUE,   hide_axis_text_if_single_variable = TRUE,   hide_label_if_prop_below = 0.01,   inverse = FALSE,   vertical = FALSE,   digits = 0,   data_label_decimal_symbol = ".",   x_axis_label_width = 25,   strip_width = 25,   sort_by = ".upper",   descend = TRUE,   variables_always_at_top = NULL,   variables_always_at_bottom = NULL,   table_wide = TRUE,   table_main_question_as_header = FALSE,   translations = list(last_sep = " and ", table_heading_N = "Total (N)",     add_n_to_label_prefix = " (N = ", add_n_to_label_suffix = ")",     add_n_to_category_prefix = " (N = [", add_n_to_category_infix = ",",     add_n_to_category_suffix = "])", by_total = "Everyone", sigtest_variable_header_1 =     "Var 1", sigtest_variable_header_2 = "Var 2", crowd_all = "All", crowd_target =     "Target", crowd_others = "Others"),   plot_height = 15,   colour_palette = NULL,   colour_2nd_binary_cat = "#ffffff",   colour_na = "grey",   label_font_size = 6,   main_font_size = 6,   strip_font_size = 6,   legend_font_size = 6,   font_family = "sans",   path = NULL,   docx_template = NULL )

title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
text: data data.frame/tibble srvyr-object (experimental) data.frame // required data used plotting. dep, indep Variable selections <tidyselect> // Default: NULL, meaning everything dep, nothing indep. Columns data. dep compulsory. type Kind output scalar<character> // default: "prop_plot" (optional) list registered types session, use get_makeme_types(). ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. require_common_categories Check common categories scalar<logical> // default: NULL (optional) Whether check items share common categories. crowd group(s) display results vector<character> // default: c("target", "others", "") (optional) Choose whether produce results target (mesos) group, others, , combinations . mesos_var Variable data indicating groups tailor reports scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column name data indicating groups mesos reports produced. mesos_group scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) String, target group. simplify_output scalar<logical> // default: TRUE TRUE, list output single output element return element , whereas list multiple elements return list. hide_for_crowd_if_all_na Hide variable output containing NA scalar<boolean> // default: TRUE Whether remove variables (particular useful mesos) values NA hide_for_crowd_if_valid_n_below Hide variable variable < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer n observations (always ignoring NA). hide_for_crowd_if_category_k_below Hide variable < k categories scalar<integer> // default: 2 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer k used categories (always ignoring NA). Defaults 2 unitary plot/table rarely informative. hide_for_crowd_if_category_n_below Hide variable category < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains category less n observations (ignoring NA) Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_crowd_if_cell_n_below Hide variable cell < n scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd combination dep-indep results cell less n observations (ignoring NA). Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditional hiding scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Select one crowd output groups. selected, hide variable across crowd-outputs reason displayed hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd. instance, say: crowd = c("target", "others"), hide_variable_if_all_na = TRUE, hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd = "target" hide variables target others-outputs NA target-group. hide_indep_cat_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditionally hide independent categories scalar<logical> // default: FALSE hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd specified, categories indep variable(s) hidden crowd exist crowds specified hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd? useful e.g. indep academic disciplines, mesos_var institutions, specific institution interested seeing academic disciplines offer . add_n_to_label Add N= variable label scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. totals Include totals scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include totals output. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. showNA Show NA categories vector<character> // default: c("ifany", "always", "never") (optional) Choose whether show NA categories results. data_label Data label scalar<character> // default: "proportion" (optional) One "proportion", "percentage", "percentage_bare", "count", "mean", "median". html_interactive Toggle interactive plot scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether plot interactive (ggiraph) static (ggplot2). hide_axis_text_if_single_variable Hide y-axis text just single variable scalar<boolean> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether hide text y-axis label just single variable. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. inverse Flag swap x-axis faceting scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, swaps x-axis faceting. vertical Display plot vertically scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, display plot vertically. digits Decimal places scalar<integer> // default: 0L (optional) Number decimal places. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. x_axis_label_width, strip_width Label width x-axis strip texts plots scalar<integer> // default: 20 (optional) Width labels used categorical column names x-axis texts strip texts. sort_by sort output vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Sort output (collapse requested). using indep-argument, sorting differs ordered factors unordered factors: Ordering ordered factors always respected output. Unordered factors reordered sort_by. Currently, works best single dep. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".id" Sort variable names. ".by_group" groups argument. character() Character vector category labels sum together. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. variables_always_at_top, variables_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. table_wide Pivot table wider scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether pivot table wider. table_main_question_as_header Table main question header scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include main question header table. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. plot_height DOCX-setting scalar<numeric> // default: 12 (optional) DOCX plots need height, currently set easily Quarto chunk option. colour_palette Colour palette vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Must contain least number unique values (including missing) data set. colour_2nd_binary_cat Colour second binary category scalar<character> // default: "#ffffff" (optional) Colour second category binary variables. Often useful hide . colour_na Colour NA category scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Colour single string NA values, showNA "ifany" "always". main_font_size, label_font_size, strip_font_size, legend_font_size Font sizes scalar<integer> // default: 6 (optional) DOCX-OUTPUT. output adjusted using e.g. ggplot2::theme() set global theme (ggplot2::theme_set()). Font sizes general text (6), data label text (3), strip text (6) legend text (6). font_family Font family scalar<character> // default: "sans" (optional) Word font family. See officer::fp_text. path Output path DOCX scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path save docx-output. docx_template Filename rdocx object scalar<character>|<rdocx>-object // default: NULL (optional) Can either valid character path reference Word file, existing rdocx-object memory.

title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
text: ggplot-object, optionally extended ggplot object ggiraph features.

title: Embed Interactive Plot of Various Kinds Using Tidyselect Syntax — makeme
code: makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = b_1:b_3)  makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = b_1, indep = x1_sex)  makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = b_1:b_3, indep = c(x1_sex, x2_human),        type = "sigtest_table_html") #>   Var 1    Var 2                         .bi_test  .p_value n_valid_Males #> 1   b_1   x1_sex Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.7280089           151 #> 2   b_1 x2_human Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.5363252            NA #> 3   b_2   x1_sex Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.4474979           151 #> 4   b_2 x2_human Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.9552449            NA #> 5   b_3   x1_sex Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.8496092           151 #> 6   b_3 x2_human Chi-squared Goodness-of-Fit Test 0.2604879            NA #>   n_valid_Females n_Males n_Females n_valid_Definitely humanoid n_valid_Robot? #> 1             149     151       149                          NA             NA #> 2              NA      NA        NA                         144            156 #> 3             149     151       149                          NA             NA #> 4              NA      NA        NA                         144            156 #> 5             149     151       149                          NA             NA #> 6              NA      NA        NA                         144            156 #>   n_Definitely humanoid n_Robot? #> 1                    NA       NA #> 2                   144      156 #> 3                    NA       NA #> 4                   144      156 #> 5                    NA       NA #> 6                   144      156 makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = b_1, indep = x1_sex,        type = "cat_prop_plot_docx") #> rdocx document with 2 element(s) #>  #> * styles: #>                 Normal              heading 1              heading 2  #>            "paragraph"            "paragraph"            "paragraph"  #>              heading 3 Default Paragraph Font           Normal Table  #>            "paragraph"            "character"                "table"  #>                No List                 strong               centered  #>            "numbering"            "character"            "paragraph"  #>         table_template    Light List Accent 2            Titre 1 Car  #>                "table"                "table"            "character"  #>            Titre 2 Car            Titre 3 Car          Image Caption  #>            "character"            "character"            "paragraph"  #>          Table Caption     Table Professional                  toc 1  #>            "paragraph"                "table"            "paragraph"  #>                  toc 2           Balloon Text    Texte de bulles Car  #>            "paragraph"            "paragraph"            "character"  #>           reference_id          graphic title            table title  #>            "character"            "paragraph"            "paragraph"  #>  #> * Content at cursor location: #>   level num_id text style_name content_type #> 1    NA     NA          Normal    paragraph makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = p_1:p_4, indep = x2_human,        type = "cat_table_html") #> # A tibble: 8 × 8 #>   .variable_label `Is respondent human?` `Strongly disagree (%)` #>   <ord>           <fct>                  <chr>                   #> 1 Yellow Party    Robot?                 16.03                   #> 2 Yellow Party    Definitely humanoid    20.83                   #> 3 Blue Party      Robot?                 26.28                   #> 4 Blue Party      Definitely humanoid    19.44                   #> 5 Green Party     Robot?                 25.00                   #> 6 Green Party     Definitely humanoid    13.89                   #> 7 Red Party       Robot?                 19.23                   #> 8 Red Party       Definitely humanoid    16.67                   #> # ℹ 5 more variables: `Somewhat disagree (%)` <chr>, #> #   `Somewhat agree (%)` <chr>, `Strongly agree (%)` <chr>, `NA (%)` <chr>, #> #   `Total (N)` <int> makeme(data = ex_survey,        dep = b_1:b_3,        crowd = c("target", "others", "all"),        mesos_var = "f_uni",        mesos_group = "Uni of A") #> $Target  #>  #> $Others  #>  #> $All  #>

what: Provides a range (or single value) for N in data, given dep and indep — n_range
title: Provides a range (or single value) for N in data, given dep and indep — n_range
text: Provides range (single value) N data, given dep indep

what: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
title: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
text: Offers systematic way conditional reporting figures tables many (bivariate combinations ) variables, typically survey data. Contains interactive 'ggiraph'-based (https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ggiraph) plotting functions data frame-based summary tables (bivariate significance tests, frequencies/proportions, unique open ended responses, etc) many arguments customization, extensions possible. Uses global options() system neatly reducing redundant code. Also contains tools immediate saving objects returning hashed link object, useful creating download links high resolution images upon rendering 'Quarto'. Suitable highly customized reports, primarily intended survey research.

title: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
text: Maintainer: Stephan Daus stephus.daus@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Julia Silge (Author internal scale_x_reordered) [contributor] David Robinson (Author internal scale_x_reordered) [contributor] Nordic Institute Studies Innovation, Research Education (NIFU) [funder] Kristiania University College [funder]

text: Summarize survey dataset use tables graphs

title: Summarize a survey dataset for use in tables and graphs — summarize_cat_cat_data
code: summarize_cat_cat_data(   data,   dep = colnames(data),   indep = NULL,   ...,   showNA = c("ifany", "always", "never"),   totals = FALSE,   sort_by = ".upper",   data_label = c("percentage_bare", "percentage", "proportion", "count"),   digits = 0,   add_n_to_label = FALSE,   add_n_to_category = FALSE,   hide_label_if_prop_below = 0.01,   data_label_decimal_symbol = ".",   categories_treated_as_na = NULL,   label_separator = NULL,   descend = FALSE,   variables_always_at_bottom = NULL,   variables_always_at_top = NULL,   translations = list(),   call = rlang::caller_env() )

title: Summarize a survey dataset for use in tables and graphs — summarize_cat_cat_data
text: data data.frame/tibble srvyr-object (experimental) data.frame // required data used plotting. dep, indep Variable selections <tidyselect> // Default: NULL, meaning everything dep, nothing indep. Columns data. dep compulsory. ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. showNA Show NA categories vector<character> // default: c("ifany", "always", "never") (optional) Choose whether show NA categories results. totals Include totals scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include totals output. sort_by sort output vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Sort output (collapse requested). using indep-argument, sorting differs ordered factors unordered factors: Ordering ordered factors always respected output. Unordered factors reordered sort_by. Currently, works best single dep. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".id" Sort variable names. ".by_group" groups argument. character() Character vector category labels sum together. data_label Data label scalar<character> // default: "proportion" (optional) One "proportion", "percentage", "percentage_bare", "count", "mean", "median". digits Decimal places scalar<integer> // default: 0L (optional) Number decimal places. add_n_to_label Add N= variable label scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. variables_always_at_top, variables_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. call Internal call obj:<call> // Default: rlang::caller_env() (optional) absolute relative folderpaths required, strings.

title: saros 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-09-03

title: saros 1.2.0
text: makeme() takes S3-methods eases expansions. embed_* thus lifecycle soft-deprecated.

title: saros 1.2.0
text: n_range() gives n_range given dataset, dependent independent variables. n_range2() n_range() takes makeme()-object convenience. make_link() generating downloadable figures, tables, data anything else, spot. ggsaver() minor wrapper ease using make_link ggplot2::ggsave(). fig_height_h_barchart() estimates optimal figure height horizontal barchart. fig_height_h_barchart2() , takes makeme()-object convenience. makeme.cat_plot() allows sorting within dependent variable--independent variable (facet-sort)

title: saros 1.2.0
text: many list, see saros 1.1.0 .

title: saros 1.1.0
text: -feat: Removed colour_palette (#328) -fix: Argument chapter_qmd_start_section_filepath now effect. (#321) -fix: simplified create_email_credentials (#305) -fix: pkgdown recode_checkbox_sets (#304) -fix: cat_*_plot now displays keys unused categories legend (#301) -fix: single_y_bivariates_if_deps_above longer affects univariates (#300) -fix: robust estimate_plot_height dep one NA category (#299) -fix: Significance test now works edge cases (#297) -feat: chr_table now ignores NA empty strings. (#296) -fix: serialized_format now actually supports qs, installed. (#293) -feat: Added default replace_heading_for_group (#291) -feat: Removed flexi-app (#289) -feat: Removed unnecessary rendering-assistance tools. (#287) -feat: gen_qmd_index now refactored (#286) - simplified gen_qmd_file, better handles index report - Also allows separate qmd_snippets start end index - Extract formats report_header_yaml used create links -fix: insert_obj_in_qmd now uses conv_to_valid_obj_name() (#284) -feat: Removed saving png files rarely used. (#283) -fix: crosstable3() now handles character vectors. (#278)

title: saros 1.0.3
text: Added arguments plot text sizes, useful defaults Word HTML layouts. attach_qualtrics_labels now flexible. Minor fix sanitize_labels. Internal change accommodate ggplot2 3.5.0. Improved performance argument validation checks. setup_access_restrictions now accepts NULL password input. setup_access_restrictions now can warn instead error rel_parent_path exist. sort_by now correctly sorts descend=TRUE “.upper”, etc. Fixed list_available_element_types Set one long-running test draft_report run maintainer’s local computer. sanitize_labels now option translate ASCII HTML-escaped characters unicode.

title: saros 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-26 Minor fixes CRAN manual review

title: saros 1.0.0
text: Submitted CRAN
